column4: hey, my acer 5542 shuts down on heavy cpu, i googled and it probably has something to do with overheating
how can i make sure it doesnt overheat because of the fans not turning on

update to the newest bios, acer had an issue with a bunch of laptops where the fans weren't running correctly, they issued bios updates to fix the problem, had the same type of problem with my netbook
what video card driver do you use?
the default intel driver ubuntu autodetects, not had any issues with video that made me look at it
ok because i read somewhere it only happened with open source drivers. do you have any problems after BIOS update?
nope, updated the bios and my netbook runs cooler now
did you update the BIOS from ubuntu?
no I booted freedos, I have a freedos setup in my grub menu for running dos stuff
sort of, that one is for the acer linux, not ubuntu
I will google how to update BIOS on a acer 5542 from ubuntu, because thats my only OS
you can't, the flash program won't run in ubuntu, you have to boot a windows or dos OS
i can make a freedos flash drive right?
it's a floppy image file, easier to just set grub to boot the floppy image you can download, but I think you can make a usb drive boot freedos too, not sure since I used the floppy image
that's almost exactly what I did
